item.title: Elon Musk: How to Build the Future
item.description:
Elon Musk: How to Build the Future

This interview with Elon Musk is from Y Combinator's How to Build the Future series

item.title: AI-designed websites have arrived, so what now for WordPress?
item.description:
AI-designed websites have arrived, so what now for WordPress?

It still takes hours, days,and weeks to create a well-designed website â€“ and even then, they require far more maintenance than one might expect. In the age of machine learning, space microphones that can hear gravity, and cars that can drive themselves, the process of building a website still seems so unnecessarily clunky, even some 27 years since their invention.

item.title: No title
item.description: SpaceX President Shotwell: We anticipate return to flight in November, meaning down for three months. Next flight from CCAFS, then to VAFB.

item.title: How Google And Others Are Plotting The Revenge Of The Web App
item.description:
How Google And Others Are Plotting The Revenge Of The Web App

For Alex Russell, a developer at Google, making web apps better isn't just a job: It's a personal belief. Since last year, Russell has been championing a new breed of web-based apps that could replace the ones you get from an app store.

item.title: Ants are destroying your plants by nurturing perfect aphid colonies
item.description:
Ants are destroying your plants by nurturing perfect aphid colonies

One of the worst effects of ant infestation doesn't happen inside your house or on your picnic blanket. It takes place in farms and gardens, where many species of ants tend to herds of aphids. These tiny insects are a bane to plants-aphids weaken plants by feeding on their sap, and they sometimes transmit deadly viruses while eating.

item.title: How the Chromebook quietly grew into the machine that's about to change the computer industry
item.description:
How the Chromebook quietly grew into the machine that's about to change the computer industry

Google's first Chromebook was the kind of laptop you'd design if you didn't give a damn about laptop design. It was thick, heavy, rubbery, boring, and black. Black keys, black body, black trackpad, black everything. Everything about the Cr-48 was designed to communicate that this device was still an experiment.

item.title: Raspberry Pi sells over 10 million computers
item.description:
Raspberry Pi sells over 10 million computers

Four years since it first went on sale to eager developers, the credit card-sized Raspberry Pi computer has sold an impressive 10 million units. It remains the UK's best-selling computer ever-and a reminder that you don't have to be a Silicon Valley heavyweight to create a successful slice of tech.

item.title: The Next Industrial Revolution Is Coming and It Could Destroy Millions of Jobs
item.description:
The Next Industrial Revolution Is Coming and It Could Destroy Millions of Jobs

An interview with the Economist columnist Ryan Avent on his new book about how technology will change the labor force.

item.title: OSIRIS-REx probe launched to asteroid in compelling search for the origins of life
item.description:
OSIRIS-REx probe launched to asteroid in compelling search for the origins of life

Like reaching back in time to examine the conditions that existed in the ancient solar system, NASA today launched a robotic probe to visit Asteroid Bennu and return an unspoiled sample of the primitive body that may hold the seeds of life.

item.title: Beyond the iPhone
item.description:
Beyond the iPhone

I enjoy the writing of Farhad Manjoo, tech columnist at The New York Times, but I was prepared for the hottest of hot takes when I saw his latest column, penned just hours after Apple's latest product unveiling, was titled What's Really Missing From the New iPhone: Dazzle.
